alert.note: Alert for Baltimore; Baltimore City; Harford (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 3:45PM EDT until June 27 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL HARFORD AND EAST CENTRAL BALTIMORE COUNTIES AND NORTHEASTERN BALTIMORE CITY... At 344 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fallston to Carney, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotter reported quarter size Fullerton. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Baltimore, Aberdeen, Towson, Bel Air South, Parkville, Bel Air North, Carney, Perry Hall, Rosedale, Rossville, Timonium, White Marsh, Fallston, Riverside, Hampton, Kingsville, Pleasant Hills, Jarrettsville, Perryman and Lutherville-Timonium. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Sterling Virginia.
